str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
This; he, she, it.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From diatithemai; properly, a disposition, i.e. a contract.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I appoint, make (of a covenant), (b) I make (a will). Middle voice from dia and tithemi; to put apart, i.e. dispose.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
Of Hebrew origin; Israel, the adopted name of Jacob, including his descendants.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

str2: To write upon, inscribe, imprint a mark on. From epi and grapho; to inscribe.
